methods.javadoc:
Gets the destination program for addresses that have been translated.
@return program1.
methods.name: getDestinationProgram
methods.comment: Gets the destination program for addresses that have been translated.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the source program for obtaining the addresses that need to be translated.
@return program2.
methods.name: getSourceProgram
methods.comment: Gets the source program for obtaining the addresses that need to be translated.

methods.javadoc:
Converts the given source address to the returned destination address.
 This interface is intended to translate an address from the source program to an 
 address in the destination program.
@param sourceAddress the source address to be converted.
@return the destination address that is equivalent in some way to the source address.
 How the address is equivalent depends upon the particular translator.
 throws AddressTranslationException if the address can't be translated to an equivalent
 address in the other program.
methods.name: getAddress
methods.comment:
Converts the given source address to the returned destination address.
 This interface is intended to translate an address from the source program to an 
 address in the destination program.

params.name: sourceAddress
params.comment: the source address to be converted.

return.comment:
the destination address that is equivalent in some way to the source address.
 How the address is equivalent depends upon the particular translator.
 throws AddressTranslationException if the address can't be translated to an equivalent
 address in the other program.

methods.javadoc:
This method should return true if it can translate an address set from the source program 
 to an address set for the destination program and there is a one to one correspondence 
 between the two programs addresses. 
 In other words two addresses that make up the start and end of an address range
 would be at the same distance and relative location from each other as the equivalent two 
 individual translated addresses are from each other.
 Otherwise this should return false.
methods.name: isOneForOneTranslator
methods.comment:
This method should return true if it can translate an address set from the source program 
 to an address set for the destination program and there is a one to one correspondence 
 between the two programs addresses. 
 In other words two addresses that make up the start and end of an address range
 would be at the same distance and relative location from each other as the equivalent two 
 individual translated addresses are from each other.
 Otherwise this should return false.

methods.javadoc:
Converts the given source address range to the returned destination address range. This interface is intended to translate an address range from the source program to an address range in the destination program.
This method should be implemented if isOneForOneTranslator() returns true. @param sourceAddressSet the source address set to be converted. @return the destination address range that is equivalent in some way to the source address range. How the address range is equivalent depends upon the particular translator. throws AddressTranslationException if the address set can't be translated to an equivalent address range in the other program.
methods.name: getAddressRange
methods.comment:
Converts the given source address range to the returned destination address range.
 This interface is intended to translate an address range from the source program to an 
 address range in the destination program.
 This method should be implemented if isOneForOneTranslator() returns true.

return.comment:
the destination address range that is equivalent in some way to the source address range.
 How the address range is equivalent depends upon the particular translator.
 throws AddressTranslationException if the address set can't be translated to an equivalent
 address range in the other program.

methods.javadoc:
Converts the given source address set to the returned destination address set. This interface is intended to translate an address set from the source program to an address set in the destination program.
This method should be implemented if isOneForOneTranslator() returns true. @param sourceAddressSet the source address set to be converted. @return the destination address set that is equivalent in some way to the source address set. How the address set is equivalent depends upon the particular translator. throws AddressTranslationException if the address set can't be translated to an equivalent address set in the other program.
methods.name: getAddressSet
methods.comment:
Converts the given source address set to the returned destination address set.
 This interface is intended to translate an address set from the source program to an 
 address set in the destination program.
 This method should be implemented if isOneForOneTranslator() returns true.

params.name: sourceAddressSet
params.comment: the source address set to be converted.

return.comment:
the destination address set that is equivalent in some way to the source address set.
 How the address set is equivalent depends upon the particular translator.
 throws AddressTranslationException if the address set can't be translated to an equivalent
 address set in the other program.
